boardgame.name: Wallenstein (first edition)
boardgame.description: Historically, Albrecht von Wallenstein, duke of Friedland and Mecklenburg, was one of the most important mercenary commanders of the Imperial army during the Thirty Years' War (1618-48). His overweening ambition was to head a large central European empire, which got him dismissed in 1630. Such was his power, however, that the empire was forced to reinstate him when Sweden came into the fray. He recovered Bohemia, but was defeated by Gustavus Adolphus at L_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;uuml;tzen, and was again dismissed. His subsequent intrigues with Protestant forces alarmed the Catholic princes who were probably complicit in his assassination in 1634 by Irish mercenaries at Eger, Bohemia._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The game begins with the start of the war, each player controlling several countries. Player actions include the conquest of new countries, tax collection, erection of buildings (i.e. development of the economy), feeding the populace, victualing the army, etc. Some actions increase the chance for unrest, and expensive rebellions can occur. The strongest power at the end wins._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Employs the cube tower included in the publisher's previous game, Im Zeichen des Kreuzes._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Re-implemented by:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Shogun_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Wallenstein (second edition)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

Box has suffered some damage (casualty of shipping from Germany) as follows: - slight creasing on box bottom at the top - very minor wear on box lid_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s bottom corners - very small (0.5 cm) tear in artwork on box bottom_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s top left corner - creasing/denting on the bottom edge of the box_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s right side (both on box top and box bottom), with some tearing (about 3 cm) in artwork and creasing in box bottom (see photos for example) No damage at all to the box lid_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s top or left sides. Note that the photos are actually of a different box with slightly worse damage than the one for sale.

Brand new, still in shrinkwrap. Box has suffered some damage (casualty of shipping from Germany) as follows: - shallow 2-3 cm crease on left side at the top front corner - slight creases on front at top left, top right, and bottom left corners (very difficult to notice) - creasing and very small (_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt; 1 cm) tear in bottom right corner of lid top - small creasing on bottom right corner of lid - damage to bottom left corner: creases and minor (_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt; 0.5 cm) tearing to the lid, and a long crease and 2.5 cm tear in bottom (see photo) On a bookshelf, this copy would not appear damaged -- you have to hold it in your hands to notice. Marked as _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Very Good_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; because while the box exterior is damaged a little, it is otherwise brand new and the parts inside are untouched.
